intro: Willoughbya lehmannii, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Asparagaceae and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments, with succulent leaves that store water. It produces showy blooms during the warmer months, often attracting pollinators such as birds and insects. Willoughbya lehmannii is a hardy species that thrives in well-drained soils and full sun.
